member.name: Windows.FreeIDListArray
member.summary: Frees the memory used by a pointer to an item identifier list (PIDL) list array.
member.param: A pointer to the list of cItems PIDLs, stored as an array.
The number of items in the array.

member.name: Windows.FreeIDListArrayChild
member.summary: Releases the memory space for the array of pointers to child item IDs. This releases both the PITEMID_CHILDs within the array and the array itself.
member.param: A pointer to the PIDL list, stored as an array of cItems elements.
The number of items in the array.

member.name: Windows.FreeIDListArrayFull
member.summary: Releases the memory space for the pointer to an item identifier list (PIDL) array. This releases both the PIDLIST_ABSOLUTEs within the array and the array itself.
member.param: A pointer to the PIDL list, stored as an array of cItems elements.
The number of items in the array.

member.name: Windows.FreeKnownFolderDefinitionFields
member.summary: Frees the allocated fields in the result from .
member.param: A pointer to a structure that contains information about the given known folder.

member.name: Windows.GetCurrentProcessExplicitAppUserModelID
member.summary: Retrieves the application-defined, explicit Application User Model ID (AppUserModelID) for the current process.
member.param: A pointer that receives the address of the AppUserModelID assigned to the process. The caller is responsible for freeing this string with when it is no longer needed.
member.returns: If this function succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: Windows.SetContractDelegateWindow
member.summary: Associates an app window other than the primary foreground window with an app's contracts. Use this function if you are a developer writing a Windows Store app in native C++.
member.param: The handle of the app window normally associated with its contracts.
The handle of another of the app's windows that will act as the contract delegate for hwndSource. Set this value to NULL to remove the delegate connection.

member.name: Windows.SetCurrentProcessExplicitAppUserModelID
member.summary: Specifies a unique application-defined Application User Model ID (AppUserModelID) that identifies the current process to the taskbar. This identifier allows an application to group its associated processes and windows under a single taskbar button.
member.param: Pointer to the AppUserModelID to assign to the current process.
member.returns: If this function succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: Windows.SHAddFolderPathToLibrary
member.summary: Adds a folder to a library.
member.param: Pointer to an object to which to add the folder.
The folder to add, specified by path.
member.returns: If this function succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: Windows.SHAssocEnumHandlers
member.summary: Returns an enumeration object for a specified set of file name extension handlers.
member.param: A pointer to a null-terminated buffer that contains a single file type extension, for instance ".jpg". Only handlers associated with the given extension are enumerated. This parameter may not be NULL.

param.name: afFilter
param.para: Specifies the enumeration handler filter applied to the full list of handlers that results from the value given in pszExtra. One of the following values.

| Value | Description | |-------|-------------| | ASSOC_FILTER_NONE | Return all handlers. | | ASSOC_FILTER_RECOMMENDED | Return only recommended handlers. A handler sets its recommended status in the registry when it is installed. An initial status of non-recommended can later be promoted to recommended as a result of user action. |

member.param: When this method returns, contains the address of a pointer to an object.
member.returns: If this function succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: Windows.SHAssocEnumHandlersForProtocolByApplication
member.summary: Gets an enumeration interface that provides access to handlers associated with a given protocol.
member.param: Pointer to a string that specifies the protocol.
A reference to the IID of the interface to retrieve through enumHandlers, typically IID_IEnumAssocHandlers.
When this method returns, contains the interface pointer requested in riid. This is typically .
member.returns: If this function succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: Windows.SHCreateAssociationRegistration
member.summary: Creates an object based on the stock implementation of the interface provided by Windows.
member.param: A reference to the IID of the requested interface.
When this function returns, contains the address of a pointer to the object.
member.returns: If this function succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: Windows.SHCreateDefaultExtractIcon
member.summary: Creates a standard icon extractor, whose defaults can be further configured via the interface.
member.param: A reference to interface ID.
The address of interface pointer.
member.returns: If this function succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: Windows.SHCreateItemFromIDList
member.summary: Creates and initializes a Shell item object from a pointer to an item identifier list (PIDL). The resulting shell item object supports the interface.
member.param: The source PIDL.
A reference to the IID of the requested interface.
When this function returns, contains the interface pointer requested in riid. This will typically be or.
member.returns: If this function succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: Windows.SHCreateItemFromParsingName
member.summary: Creates and initializes a Shell item object from a parsing name.
member.param: A pointer to a display name.

param.name: pbc
param.para: Optional. A pointer to a bind context used to pass parameters as inputs and outputs to the parsing function. These passed parameters are often specific to the data source and are documented by the data source owners. For example, the file system data source accepts the name being parsed (as a structure), using the STR_FILE_SYS_BIND_DATA bind context parameter.

STR_PARSE_PREFER_FOLDER_BROWSING can be passed to indicate that URLs are parsed using the file system data source when possible. Construct a bind context object using and populate the values using . See Bind Context String Keys for a complete list of these. See the Parsing With Parameters Sample for an example of the use of this parameter.
If no data is being passed to or received from the parsing function, this value can be NULL.

member.param: A reference to the IID of the interface to retrieve through ppv, typically IID_IShellItem or IID_IShellItem2.
When this method returns successfully, contains the interface pointer requested in riid. This is typically or .
member.returns: If this function succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: Windows.SHCreateItemFromRelativeName
member.summary: Creates and initializes a Shell item object from a relative parsing name.
member.param: A pointer to the parent Shell item.
A pointer to a null-terminated, Unicode string that specifies a display name that is relative to the psiParent.
A pointer to a bind context that controls the parsing operation. This parameter can be NULL.
A reference to an interface ID.
When this function returns, contains the interface pointer requested in riid. This will usually be or.
member.returns: If this function succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: Windows.SHCreateItemInKnownFolder
member.summary: Creates a Shell item object for a single file that exists inside a known folder.
member.param: A reference to the KNOWNFOLDERID, a GUID that identifies the folder that contains the item.
Flags that specify special options in the object retrieval. This value can be 0; otherwise, one or more of the values.

A pointer to a null-terminated buffer that contains the file name of the new item as a Unicode string. This parameter can also be NULL. In this case, an that represents the known folder itself is created.
A reference to the IID of the interface that represents the item, retrieved through ppv. This value is typically IID_IShellItem or IID_IShellItem2.
When this function returns successfully, contains the interface pointer requested in riid. This is typically or .
member.returns: If this function succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: Windows.SHCreateItemWithParent
member.summary: Create a Shell item, given a parent folder and a child item ID.
member.param: The IDList of the parent folder of the item being created; the IDList of psfParent. This parameter can be NULL, if psfParent is specified.
A pointer to interface that specifies the shell data source of the child item specified by the pidl.This parameter can be NULL, if pidlParent is specified.
A child item ID relative to its parent folder specified by psfParent or pidlParent.
A reference to an interface ID.
When this function returns, contains the interface pointer requested in riid. This will typically be or.
member.returns: If this function succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: Windows.SHCreateLibrary
member.summary: Creates an object.
member.param: The IID for . (See usage remarks.)
Receives a new object. (See usage remarks.)
member.returns: If this function succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: Windows.SHCreateShellItemArray
member.summary: Creates a Shell item array object.
member.param: The ID list of the parent folder of the items specified in ppidl. If psf is specified, this parameter can be NULL. If this pidlParent is not specified, it is computed from the psf parameter using .
The Shell data source object that is the parent of the child items specified in ppidl. If pidlParent is specified, this parameter can be NULL.
The number of elements in the array specified by ppidl.
The list of child item IDs for which the array is being created. This value can be NULL.
When this function returns, contains the address of an interface pointer.
member.returns: If this function succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: Windows.SHCreateShellItemArrayFromDataObject
member.summary: Creates a Shell item array object from a data object.
member.param: A pointer to interface.
A reference to the desired interface ID.
When this method returns, contains the interface pointer requested in riid. This is typically .
member.returns: If this function succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: Windows.SHCreateShellItemArrayFromIDLists
member.summary: Creates a Shell item array object from a list of structures.
member.param: The number of elements in the array.
A list of cidl constant pointers to structures.
When this function returns, contains an interface pointer.
member.returns: If this function succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: Windows.SHCreateShellItemArrayFromShellItem
member.summary: Creates an array of one element from a single Shell item.
member.param: Pointer to object that represents the item.
A reference to the IID of the interface to retrieve through ppv, typically IID_IShellItemArray.
When this method returns, contains the interface pointer requested in riid. This is typically a pointer to an .
member.returns: If this function succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: Windows.SHGetIDListFromObject
member.summary: Retrieves the pointer to an item identifier list (PIDL) of an object.
member.param: A pointer to the of the object from which to get the PIDL.
When this function returns, contains a pointer to the PIDL of the given object.
member.returns: If this function succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: Windows.SHGetItemFromDataObject
member.summary: Creates an or related object based on an item specified by an .
member.param: A pointer to the source instance.
One or more values from the enumeration to specify options regarding the target object. This value can be 0.
A reference to the IID of the interface to retrieve through ppv, typically IID_IShellItem.
When this method returns, contains the interface pointer requested in riid. This is typically .
member.returns: If this function succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: Windows.SHGetItemFromObject
member.summary: Retrieves an for an object.
member.param: A pointer to the of the object.
Reference to the desired IID.
When this method returns, contains the interface pointer requested in riid. This is typically or a related interface.
member.returns: If this function succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: Windows.SHGetNameFromIDList
member.summary: Retrieves the display name of an item identified by its IDList.
member.param: A PIDL that identifies the item.
A value from the enumeration that specifies the type of display name to retrieve.
A value that, when this function returns successfully, receives the address of a pointer to the retrieved display name.
member.returns: If this function succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: Windows.SHGetPropertyStoreFromIDList
member.summary: Retrieves an object that supports or related interfaces from a pointer to an item identifier list (PIDL).
member.param: A pointer to an item ID list.
One or more values from the constants. This parameter can also be NULL.
A reference to the desired interface ID.
When this function returns, contains the interface pointer requested in riid. This is typically or a related interface.

member.name: Windows.SHGetPropertyStoreFromParsingName
member.summary: Returns a property store for an item, given a path or parsing name.
member.param: A pointer to a null-terminated Unicode string that specifies the item path.
A pointer to a object, which provides access to a bind context. This value can be NULL.
One or more values from the constants. This parameter can also be NULL.
A reference to the desired interface ID.
When this function returns, contains the interface pointer requested in riid. This is typically or a related interface.
member.returns: If this function succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: Windows.SHGetTemporaryPropertyForItem
member.summary: Retrieves the temporary property for the given item. A temporary property is a read/write store that holds properties only for the lifetime of the object, rather than being persisted back into the item.
member.param: A pointer to the item for which the temporary property is to be retrieved.
The property key.
A pointer to the temporary property for the item.
member.returns: If this function succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: Windows.SHLoadLibraryFromItem
member.summary: Creates and loads an object from a specified library definition file.
member.param: An object for the library definition file to load.
One or more storage medium flags that specify access and sharing modes for the library object. Commonly specified flags are STGM_READ or STGM_READWRITE. For more information, see STGM.
The IID for . (See usage remarks.)
Receives the loaded object. (See usage remarks.)
member.returns: If this function succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: Windows.SHLoadLibraryFromKnownFolder
member.summary: Creates and loads an object for a specified known folder ID.
member.param: The KNOWNFOLDERID value that identifies the known folder to load into the object.
One or more storage medium flags that specify access and sharing modes for the library object. Commonly specified flags are STGM_READ or STGM_READWRITE. For more information, see STGM.
The IID for . (See Remarks for more information.)
When this function returns successfully, receives the loaded object. (See Remarks for more information.)
member.returns: If this function succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: Windows.SHLoadLibraryFromParsingName
member.summary: Creates and loads an object for a specified path.
member.param: The path for which to load the object.
One or more storage medium flags that specify access and sharing modes for the library object. Commonly specified flags are STGM_READ or STGM_READWRITE. For more information, see STGM.
A reference to the IID of the interface to retrieve through ppv, typically IID_IShellLibrary.
When this method returns successfully, contains the interface pointer requested in riid. This is typically .
member.returns: If this function succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: Windows.SHRemoveFolderPathFromLibrary
member.summary: Removes a folder from a library.
member.param: The object from which to remove the folder.
The path of the folder to remove.
member.returns: If this function succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: Windows.SHResolveLibrary
member.summary: Resolves all locations in a library, even those locations that have been moved or renamed.
member.param: A pointer to an object that represents the library.
member.returns: If this function succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: Windows.SHSaveLibraryInFolderPath
member.summary: Saves an object to disk.
member.param: A pointer to the object to save.
A pointer to the path to the folder in which to save the library.
A pointer to a file name under which to save the library. The file name must not include the file name extension. The file name extension is added automatically.
A value from the enumeration that specifies how to handle a library name collision.

A pointer to a string that, when this function returns successfully, receives the path to the library description file into which the library was saved. If this path is not required, the value of this parameter can be NULL.
member.returns: If this function succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: Windows.SHSetTemporaryPropertyForItem
member.summary: Sets a temporary property for the specified item. A temporary property is kept in a read/write store that holds properties only for the lifetime of the object, instead of writing them back into the item.
member.param: A pointer to the item on which the temporary property is to be set.
Reference to the that identifies the temporary property that is being set.
Reference to a that contains the value of the temporary property.
member.returns: If this function succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: Windows.SHShowManageLibraryUI
member.summary: Shows the library management dialog box, which enables users to manage the library folders and default save location.
member.param: A pointer to an object that represents the library that is to be managed.
The handle for the window that owns the library management dialog box. The value of this parameter can be NULL.
A pointer to the title for the library management dialog. To display the generic title string, set the value of this parameter to NULL.
A pointer to a help string to display below the title string in the library management dialog box. To display the generic help string, set the value of this parameter to NULL.
A value from the enumeration that specifies the behavior of the management dialog box.
member.returns: If this function succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: Windows.SHSimpleIDListFromPath
member.summary: Deprecated. Returns a pointer to an structure when passed a path.
member.param: A pointer to a null-terminated string that contains the path to be converted to a PIDL.
member.returns: Returns a pointer to an structure if successful, or NULL otherwise.
